Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: Bilbo Baggins goes on an unexpected journey to the Lonely Mountain to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A chilling tale of a totalitarian society controlled by Big Brother and constant surveillance.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A critique of the American Dream as seen through the tragic story of Jay Gatsby.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: The first book in the Harry Potter series where Harry discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: Holden Caulfield recounts the days following his expulsion from prep school in New York City.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, upbringing, and marriage in early 19th century England.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: Frodo begins his journey to destroy the One Ring with the help of the Fellowship.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A futuristic society driven by technological advancements and conditioning.

Title: Moby Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the white whale Moby Dick.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A symbologist uncovers a conspiracy within the Catholic Church while solving a murder mystery.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A shepherd named Santiago embarks on a journey to find a hidden treasure.

Title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe
Author: C.S. Lewis
Description: Four siblings discover a magical world inside a wardrobe, battling the evil White Witch.

Title: Anna Karenina
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Description: A tragic love story exploring Russian society and morality.

Title: The Hunger Games
Author: Suzanne Collins
Description: Children must fight to the death in televised games for survival in a dystopian future.

Title: The Fault in Our Stars
Author: John Green
Description: Teenagers Hazel and Augustus fall in love while coping with cancer.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Description: A family becomes caretakers of a haunted hotel with terrifying consequences.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Description: Count Dracula attempts to move from Transylvania to England, spreading vampirism.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Description: A scientist creates life, but his monstrous creation brings tragedy.

Title: The Odyssey
Author: Homer
Description: Odysseus journeys home after the Trojan War, facing mythical creatures and divine obstacles.
